result.execSummary:
The defendant Day Ah Vue was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Day Ah Vue

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 10:11 am 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears in person, pro se. 
COURT reviews waiver of right to Atty and plea form with def on the record.  VRCW.

PLEA: Ct. 1 (DC)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, def is competent to represent self, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: $100 plus costs. 
Adj: 10:18 am

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 2:29 pm 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Deft does NOT appear. 
Date and time was set for FPT. 
State notes belief that parties had reached an agreement but requests bond forfeiture and bench warrant. 
COURT notes plea hearing has been set for 6/12/2015 at 9:50 am. 
State no longer requests bench warrant or bond forfeiture. 
COURT removes jury trial date. 
Plea Hearing is set for 6/12/2015 at 9:50 am in Br. 3. 
Adj: 2:30 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 12, 2015 at 09:50 am.

dft
Pre-trial conference; final per-trial; jury trial
No address given to jail upon bonding out

Pre-trial conference on April 14, 2015 at 02:05 pm.
Final pre-trial on May 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Jury Trial on May 28, 2015 at 09:00 am.

No contact with victim(s): S.X., D.C., K.V. (3/23/01). Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Absolute sobriety. No controlled substances without a valid prescription and only in the amount prescribed.
